name: 'Bald'ness, Not The Quiz You Think It Is  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first appointed Supreme Court Justice Of the U.S., with BALD in his name?
questions.explanation:
Henry Baldwin.

	Andrew Jackson appointed him, and he served from 1830 to 1844. The first Supreme Court Justice was John Jay, appointed by Washington.

questions.text: What was the name of the American cartoonist who drew for Marvel with characters such as Captain America?
questions.explanation:
Kenneth Bald.

	Kenneth Bald had a long career with Marvel.

questions.text: What American dramatist penned Cleopatra and Caesar in 1952?
questions.explanation:
John Lloyd Balderston.

	He also wrote 'Genius of the Marne' in 1919.

questions.text: Although Ben Franklin wanted the turkey to be the national symbol of the U.S., what was actually chosen?
questions.explanation:
The Bald Eagle.

	Thank goodness dear ole Benny didn't get his way ... stuffed eagle for Thanksgiving dinner! ...no thanks.

questions.text: Who was the U.S. Secretary of Commerce under Ronald Reagan from 1981 to 1987?
questions.explanation:
Malcolm Baldrige.

	Malcolm Baldrige was in a rodeo accident, and on July 25, 1987, he died in Walnut Creek, California.

questions.text: What author is best known for describing black life in the U.S., and is equally known for his work, 'Go Tell It on the Mountain'?
questions.explanation:
James Baldwin.

	James Baldwin wrote novels, poetry and essays.

questions.text: This actor, born in Amityville on Long Island, got his start on television's 'Knots Landing', before starring in movies?
questions.explanation:
Alec Baldwin.

	Alec starred in many hit movies including, 'The Hunt for Red October' and 'Beetle Juice'.

questions.text: This 'bald' person was an American social reformer who, with others, founded the ACLU in 1920?
questions.explanation:
Roger Nash Baldwin.

	He was the director of the ACLU until 1950.

questions.text: Who was the British Conservative statesman and Prime Minister that succeeded Bonar Law (1922-1923)?
questions.explanation:
Stanley Baldwin.

	Stanley Baldwin was also Prime Minister from 1924 to 1929, and from 1935 to 1937. (Incredible as it may sound, he's the most recent Cambridge graduate to have held the office!)

questions.text: This Italian artist was decorator at Bapistry in Florence in 1456?
questions.explanation:
Alesso Baldovinetti.

	Baldovinetti's painting of the Madonna hangs in the Louvre.
